benchmark_details.name: LiSCU (Literature Summary and Character Understanding)
benchmark_details.overview: LiSCU is a new dataset of literature summaries paired with descriptions of characters that appear in them, designed to facilitate character-centric narrative understanding.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To encourage research in character-centric narrative understanding through the introduction of a new dataset and tasks.

data.source: Collected from various online study guides including Shmoop, SparkNotes, CliffsNotes, and LitCharts.
data.annotation: Descriptions were written by literary experts, typically teachers.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated using standard procedures for evaluating NLP tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in tasks related to character understanding and description generation.
methodology.validation: The dataset was validated through human evaluations and inter-annotator agreements.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis indicates more male characters than female characters (66% male).
targeted_risks.harm: Potential reinforcement of societal biases present in literature.
